content:
# I have successfully gathered 10 Iron Ore, bringing my inventory back to a usable state. 

# Now, I can proceed to smelt the Iron Ore into Iron Plates. The Stone Furnace currently has 18 coal available, which is more than enough to keep it running.

# I will insert 2 coal into the furnace for fuel and then insert the 10 Iron Ore to start the smelting process.

insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=2)  # Insert 2 coal into the Stone Furnace to fuel it
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=10)  # Insert the 10 Iron Ore into the Stone Furnace

# Now, I will wait for the smelting process to complete and check the outputs periodically.
for _ in range(20):  # Wait for a maximum of 10 seconds (checking every 0.5 seconds)
    sleep(0.5)  # Wait for the smelting process
    furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace)
    if furnace_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 4:  # Check if at least 4 Iron Plates have been produced
        break

# Check the status of the furnace and overall inventory after waiting again
print(f"Furnace inventory after waiting: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")  # Check furnace output
print(f"Inventory after iron smelting: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check overall inventory after smelting
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Check entities on the map again
